alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Hardeman (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 10:54PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Fayette and northern Hardeman Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1054 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Somerville, or 20 miles northeast of Collierville, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bolivar, Whiteville, Somerville, Cloverport, Warren, Moscow, Williston, Toone, Hickory Valley, Fayette Corners, Laconia, Vildo, Middleburg, Pattersonville, Powers, Shandy and Miller. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for west Tennessee.
